io.jeo.data

Interface Driver<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RasterDriver<T>, VectorDriver<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CSV, Directory, FileDriver, FileVectorDriver, Gbf, GDAL, GeoJSON, GeoPackage, GeoPkgBaseDriver, GeoTIFF, MBTiles, Memory, MongoDB, OGR, OGRDriver, PostGIS, Shapefile, SpatiaLite

    public interface Driver<T>
    Format driver.

    The job of a driver is to create a "connection" to data in a particular format. A driver can return either one of a dataset, or a workspace containing many datasets.

    Driver implementations must adhere to the following guidelines:

    • Be thread safe and ideally maintain no state
    • Contain a single no argument constructor

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Driver.Capability
      A capability is an operation that the driver can handle natively.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Name identifying the driver.

        This name should be no more than a few words (ideally one). It isn't meant to be a description but should be human readable.

      • aliases

        List<String> aliases()
        Secondary names identifying the driver.

        Aliases are typically shorter abbreviations for name()

      • type

        Class<T> type()
        Returns the class of object returned by the driver.

      • family

        String family()
        The family of the driver.

        This value is used to group drivers based on implementation. For example this value would indicate if the driver is based on another library that provides geo format support (GDAL, GeoTools, etc...)

      • keys

        List<Key<?>> keys()
        Returns the keys supported by the driver.

      • capabilities

        Set<Driver.Capability> capabilities()
        The driver capabilities that declare what operations the driver is capable of handling natively.

        For example, to check if a vector driver supports bounding box queries. 

           VectorDriver drv = ...;
   if (drv.capabilities().contains(VectorDriver.BOUND)) {
       // driver supports native bbox queries
   }

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(Messages messages)
        Determines if the driver is enabled.

        The messages argument is optionally used for the driver to report back any messages or exceptions that prevent the driver from being enabled.

      • canOpen

        boolean canOpen(Map<?,Object> opts,
              Messages messages)
        Determines if this driver can open a connection to the data described by the specified options.

        The messages list is optionally used for the driver to report back any messages or exceptions that prevent the driver from opening the specified data source.

        Parameters:
        opts - Options describing the data.
        messages - Messages reported from the driver, optionally null.
        Returns:
        True if the driver can open the data, otherwise false.

      • open

        T open(Map<?,Object> opts)
       throws IOException
        Opens a connection to data described by the specified options.
        Parameters:
        opts - Options describing the data to connect to.
        Returns:
        The data.
        Throws:
        IOException - In the event of a connection error such as a file system error or database connection failure.
